group_1.textLeft: Sayaka!
Did you pull it off?

group_1.textRight: Yep, everything's perfect now!

group_1.textLeft: Thank you. You've just saved the universe.

group_1.textRight: Ahaha... You're overblowing it.

group_1.textLeft: Huh? Sayaka, there's a leaf on your uniform.

group_1.textRight: Wait, really?!

group_1.textLeft: So there is... You didn't notice?

group_1.textRight: Ah... That must've been from when I was@hiding in those bushes.

group_1.textLeft: If you look closely, you can see it's covered@in all these tiny burrs...

group_1.textRight: Jeez... That's...kinda gross...

group_1.textLeft: In any case, as far as I can tell, everything@is resolved now.
To think I had just found a mirror connected@to Mitakihara just before you arrived...
I'm relieved I didn't destroy it.

group_1.textRight: Now we can officially wrap things up!
Yeah, I think we're good to get rid of it now.

group_1.textLeft: Alright. To ensure this won't ever happen again...
[flashEffect:flashWhite2][surround:1006A02]...Let's destroy this mirror!
It seems we truly are safe now.

group_1.textRight: Guess that wraps thingsâ€“
[chara:200600:effect_emotion_surprise_0][se:7226_shock]Wh-what's up?

group_1.textLeft: It's gone...!
You mean that leaf on her blouse?

group_1.textRight: Yeah, according to what Madoka and@her friends said on their way home,
the leaf vanished just as the mirror broke.
...Touka?

group_1.textCenter: Hmmm... So traveling through mirrors isn't@so simple...
If a mirror is broken, then the things that emerged@from it and their repercussions will vanish...?
We broke the mirror leading to Chuo Ward@earlier today,
but the Witches that passed through it@didn't vanish.
That instance of mirror travel was straightforward@and done properly,
and it's not as though its effects were negated.
The difference in this case is that time travel@was involved...
I shudder to think, but does that mean@there was a correction...?

group_1.textRight: Hey, would you like some tea?

group_1.textLeft: Thanks, Big Sis!
...Given recent events...it's hard to@accept, and yet...

group_1.textRight: Did you figure anything out about the story@of the disappearing leaf?

group_1.textLeft: Hmm...
It could be the case that incongruities@between the past and future...
...and the creation of numerous parallel universes running alongside ours can indeed both occur.
I wonder, then, if there's a corrective function that reconciles all the differences into a single universe...

group_1.textRight: What do you mean?

group_1.textLeft: I'm certain that the phenomenon of the@disappearing leaf...
is a demonstration of the damage done@to the past and future being corrected.

group_1.textRight: So you think breaking the mirror caused@the correction?

group_1.textLeft: That's just my guess.
Just like how it takes time for human@injuries to heal,
I think it also takes time for cosmic injuries - or@incongruities - to be accounted for and resolved.
Even if breaking the mirror is the trigger,
I think it's highly unlikely that things will be@restored as quickly as they were in this instance...
*Giggle*
This proves just how fascinating the universe is.
I've always wanted to know everything about it,@and even became one of the Magius so I could.
...But I digress.

group_1.textRight: You're not exactly sure what causes the@corrective function, then?

group_1.textLeft: I only have hypotheses, if anything.
But honestly, I do think there's a potential@being with the capacity to correct the universe.

group_1.textRight: Wh-who could that be?!

group_1.textLeft: The Mirror Witch.
Phenomena that occur by way of mirrors, such as@today's events, are voided when they're broken,
because the offshoot Witch at the end of the mirrors@annihilates the changes and makes corrections.
What's destroyed is used as energy, without@leaving a single atom behind.
Supposing all that were possible, it'd make@sense, don't you think?

group_1.textRight: So if that leaf hadn't been voided, would@the world have been altered...?

group_1.textLeft: Had it resulted in a place or a history the@Witch fancied,
the odds wouldn't be zero.
After all, our opponent can move to any@time or parallel world she sees fit,
making it as though we, who were left behind,@never even existed.

group_1.textRight: Ooh... That's scary.

group_1.textLeft: But still, as long as we remain uncertain,@if an incident like this...
...happens again in the future, we'll need to@break the mirror responsible.
That should put an end to the phenomenon@for some time.

group_1.textRight: If that's what you say, then I'm sure it@must be true.
Still, I wonder if that really will make those@incidents vanish as if they never were.

group_1.textLeft: By the way, what was it that you wanted@to ask me about today?

group_1.textRight: Ah, yes...
I wanted to consult with you about a sort of waking dream that Madoka and I both shared,
where Witches from Mitakihara in the past@came to Kamihama,
and the Mirrors Witch was responsible...
...Huh?

group_1.textLeft: I see.
It seems like the events that were voided@became waking dreams instead.
We were meant to have proceeded through@different events:
Events that existed, and yet no longer do.
